Posts.Content: May 2, 2013 04:01PM SafiAnnie wrote: I had no time to prepare really - one week from (delayed) mammography recall appt to surgery via biopsy result! The shock has actually been the worst bit. Time is needed to get one's head around it all. It took me nearly 2 weeks to get the anaesthetic out of the system - could not have gone back to work. sounds like being very fit (i'm not) is a great help. Now post lumpectomy /SNB pain in right arm is very depressing. Anyone recommend acupuncture? I don't want to be on pain meds all the time, but can't sleep without. Sorry to be depressing. I am meant to be in Africa working not here recovering!

Posts.Content: May 2, 2013 04:32PM SafiAnnie wrote: Bra definitely. I have one size up, no under wire, for daytime and a sports bra at night. I step into it! Breast really swollen still, so don't know about divot yet (2 weeks post op) Sunburn type pain in the arm and armpit is worst thing. I use a pillow under my arm at night still.

Posts.Content: May 28, 2013 04:57PM SafiAnnie wrote: Hi kayezzy66 so sorry you are having a tough time. my surgery is now 6 weeks ago and the pain under the arm is finally beginning to fade. I thought it was the worst thing and docs were not very sympathetic! I took neurontin ( a nerve pain med) which helped some, no other pain med touched it. I've cut down on the neurontin now and am using lanacaine powder over the numb/burning bits ( arm pit and inner arm). It will get better. Give yourself time, and accept all the help that is offered. It is not a small thing to go through.
